game.suite

Class ConnectFourEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • game.suite.ConnectFourEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class ConnectFourEngine
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains all the game logic for Connect Four. It also manages an instance of a ConnectFourBoard. The current player's turn and the number of rows and columns in the board are stored. Multiple operations can be performed on the board, such as checking if there is a win condition, figuring out who won and how, placing a chip in the board, resetting the board, and loading and saving the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ConnectFourEngine

        public ConnectFourEngine(java.lang.Integer boardRows,
                         java.lang.Integer boardCols,
                         java.lang.Integer startingTurn)
        Creates an instance of the Connect Four engine. Creates an instance of ConnectFourBoard automatically.
        Parameters:
        boardRows - number of rows in the ConnectFourBoard.
        boardCols - number of columns in the ConnectFourBoard.
        startingTurn - the player that will take the first turn.

      • getTurn

        public java.lang.Integer getTurn()
        Gets the player that will take the next turn.
        Returns:
        the number of the player that is next

      • getWinner

        public java.lang.Integer getWinner()
        Gets the winner of the game, if there is one. checkWin() should be called before this, otherwise this value may be stale.
        Returns:
        the number of the player that won, or 0 if there's no winner.

      • getWinCase

        public java.lang.String getWinCase()
        Gets the method by which the winning player won the game.
        Returns:
        the description of the win case. Will be empty if there is no winner.

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin()
        Checks the ConnectFourBoard for a winner. Goes through 4 cases:
        • Horizontal
        • Vertical
        • Up and to the Right
        • Up and to the Left
        The first case found is declared the winning case. A description of the win case is stored in winCase, and the player that won is stored in winner.
        Returns:
        true if a winner was found; false if no winner was found.

      • checkFull

        public boolean checkFull()
        Checks if the board is currently full, and fires an achievement if it is.
        Returns:
        true if the board is full, false if not.

      • placeChip

        public java.lang.Integer placeChip(java.lang.Integer col)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Places a chip assigned to whoever's turn it is currently.
        Parameters:
        col - the column in which to drop the player's chip.
        Returns:
        the row that the chip fell into.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the column doesn't exist in the board.

      • advanceTurn

        public void advanceTurn()
        Advances the current turn to the next player, and wraps around to player 1 when the last player is reached.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the engine to start the game over.

      • load

        public static ConnectFourEngine load(java.io.File filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Statically loads a serialized ConnectFourEngine from a file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the reference to the serialized file.
        Returns:
        A new instance of a ConnectFourEngine with the data obtained from the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When the path specified in filename could not be found.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - When the class loaded from the file isn't a ConnectFourEngine.
